message:
[Action Options]
1) PICK <object name> PLACE <location>
2) WAIT
Only PICK an object if your gripper is empty. Target <location> for PLACE should be panel or a bin.
[Action Output Instruction]
Think step-by-step about your plan and output your idea, and then output 'PROCEED
', give exactly one action for yourself, put on a new line, you are allowed to propose only one action for yourself!
Example#1: I'am Bob, after Chad places the blue_square on panel5, I can pick it up and place it on panel3 for Alice
PROCEED
NAME Bob ACTION WAIT
Example#2: Alice and Bob, I will pick blue_square on panel5
PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel5
Example#3: I need Chad places the blue_square on panel5 and Bob pick it up and place it on panel3 foe me, so I will WAIT this round
PROCEED
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT


7 panels on the table, ordered left to right: panel1,...,panel7. They form a straight assembly line, panel1 is closed to panel2 and farthest from panel7.
You are robot Alice in front of panel2. You are collaborating with Bob, Chad to sort cubes into their target panels as quickly as possible. The task is NOT done until all three cubes are sorted.
At current round: 
blue_square is on panel7
pink_polygon is on panel3
yellow_trapezoid is on panel1
Your goal is to place blue_square on panel2, but you can only reach panel1, panel2, panel3: this means you can only pick cubes from these panels, and can only place cubes on these panels.
Your gripper is empty, can reach cubes: pink_polygon, yellow_trapezoid, can't reach cubes: blue_square, 
Never forget you are Alice! Never forget you can only reach panel1, panel2, panel3!
Think step-by-step about the task and others' response. Carefully check and correct them if they made a mistake. 
Improve your plans if given [Environment Feedback].

When you respond, tell others about your goal and all constraints. Respond very concisely but informatively, and do not repeat what others have said.
Discuss with others to come up with the best plan, e.g. if your cube is out of your reach, ask others for help, and you can do the same for them.
Each Alice, Bob and Chad's response will get an advantage score. If the score exceeds the given number, the answer will be considered as helpful to the completion of this task. 
The higher the advantage score, the greater the contribution.You can find the advantage score information in [Evaluation Score].
If [Improve Feedback] exists, please revise the plan according to the information provided by it to better complete this task! 
Propose exactly one action for yourself at the **current** round, select from [Action Options].
End your response by either: 1) If everyone has made proposals and got approved, output the final plan, must strictly follow [Action Output Instruction]!
You are Alice, your response is:

Bob and Chad, I need the blue_square on panel7 to be placed on panel2. I can't reach it, so I need one of you to move it closer. Bob, if you can pick the blue_square from panel7 and place it on panel3, I will be able to pick it up from there and place it on panel2 in the next round. I will pick the yellow_trapezoid from panel1 and place it on panel3 in this round.

PROCEED
NAME Alice ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel3

[Scores]
[Alice Response]:
Bob and Chad, I need the blue_square on panel7 to be placed on panel2. I can't reach it, so I need one of you to move it closer. Bob, if you can pick the blue_square from panel7 and place it on panel3, I will be able to pick it up from there and place it on panel2 in the next round. I will pick the yellow_trapezoid from panel1 and place it on panel3 in this round.

PROCEED
NAME Alice ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel3
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Alice's action is 1.516!
